clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of In-lab PSG to WP200 for Assessing Sleep Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: Testing for Sleep Apnea in Adolescence Subjects With the WP200/WP200U Compared to an In-lab Overnight PSG Testing

brief_summary.textblock: The WP200 and/or WP200U will be compared with a PSG system which is a digital physiological recorder system, cleared for use for clinical sleep studies. The manual scoring of the PSG data, performed by a trained and authorized scorer, according to the AASM (American Academy of Sleep Medicine) guidelines, serves as a "gold standard" for all determinations of efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: sensitivity, specificity, obtained by the WP200/WP200U device automatic-computerized analysis as compared to the manual scoring of the PSG that is considered the "gold standard"
correlation obtained by the WP200/WP200U device automatic-computerized analysis as compared to the manual scoring of the PSG that is considered the "gold standard"
Agreement obtained by the WP200/WP200U device automatic-computerized analysis as compared to the manual scoring of the PSG that is considered the "gold standard"

arm_group.arm_group_label: PSG and WatchPAT200 in subjects age12-17
arm_group.description: Adolescents refered to a sleep lab for sleep lab for full night PSG

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include adolescence subjects, age 12-17, referred to the clinical sleep laboratory for an overnight sleep study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 12-17
- Subjects with a legal guardian that is able to read understand and sign the informed consent form
- Willing to sleep with the WP200/WP200U and PSG simultaneously in the sleep lab
Exclusion Criteria:
- Permanent pacemaker: atrial pacing or VVI without sinus rhythm.
- Use of one of the following medications: alpha blockers, short acting nitrates (less than 3 hours before the study)
